$SPY I think FED has been buying bonds today and Froday, theg recognize fragility of economy, so keeping rates down artificially a bit longer.

How long is a bit? 

February 1 the 6 year fed fund target rate at 0% ENDS, has to, FED knows it and Tutes know it, inflation is really ramping last 4 months PCE Gov't data and right behind, CPI, which has a higher overall # for YoY of PCE Deflator.

'Course, I expect a scary PCE Deflator on 28th and how AGGRESSIVE the FED raises rates will prob be tied to that data, known before everyone else.

body: $MSFT $AAPL All I know… if you short Apple or Microsoft… you’ll lose. Oh, and tigers are cool animals. Not bears.

Sorry for my absence. Here are some visuals you might like. 
 
$NVDA $TSLA $LYV $FB $AAPL  
 
I'll post more

From there, some rivals' original programming made a dent. Hulu ($DIS, $CMCSA) landed the 10th-most-watched original with The Handmaid's Tale (8.56 billion minutes). Apple TV+ ($AAPL) had the No. 12 show with Ted Lasso (8.16 billion minutes). And Disney+ (DIS) placed WandaVision at No. 14 for the year with 7.28 billion minutes streamed. 
 
Acquired series have always proved to be Netflix's territory, and its programs took all of the top 12 slots on that chart, led by Criminal Minds (33.87 billion minutes), CoComelon (33.28 billion), Grey's Anatomy (32.63 billion), NCIS (29.53 billion), Heartland (20.41 billion) and Manifest (19.92 billion). 
 
The few rival dents on acquired series came from Bones, the No. 13 original streaming 11 billion minutes across Amazon Prime Video ($AMZN) and Hulu (DIS, CMCSA); and No. 14 Seinfeld, which streamed 10.45 billion minutes across Hulu and Netflix during 2021. 
 
 
$NFLX

body: $AAPL listen. Buy puts. Earnings will not be as good with shortages going on. Along with the market being crap... even an okay earnings for this will rip negative because of poorly reacted markets. If this doesn’t beat earnings and revenue by like 40% we’re seeing the sh*tters. Buy puts tmr night.

$SPY Honestly, save for the exception of a few stocks... the market has already crashed. Historical $SPY charts wouldn't let you think so because $SPY is heavily weighted by just a handful of tech stocks. This will never go back to pre-covid levels. This "correction" is the best you're going to get. If you haven't bought into stocks like $AAPL and $MSFT during this correction then you missed the boat.

$QQQ $SPY $TQQQ $AAPL $MSFT

World War 7 priced in
$AAPL joe biden is a fine president
$MSFT 300 $AMD 120 $AAPL 170 tomorrow.

body:
Apple ($AAPL) is slated to unveil the "widest array of new hardware" in the company's history later this fall, Bloomberg reports. 
 
The latest newsletter from journalist Mark Gurman notes that the Cupertino, California-based Apple is expected to unveil four new iPhones - iPhone SE with 5G, iPhone 14, iPhone 14 Pro and iPhone Pro Max - along with a new MacBook Pro, iMac, Mac Pro, new MacBook Air, new AirPods Pro, three versions of the Apple Watch, a new iPad and iPad Pro. 
 
It's been widely expected that the iPhone SE with 5G and a new iPad could be unveiled at the spring event, which has traditionally been held in March or April. 
 
Bloomberg added that Apple could show off a new M1 chip for another Mac computer at the spring event, as it transitions its computers away from Intel ($INTC). 
 
It's also possible that the new iPad Pro, likely to be announced in the fall, could have an updated M-chip and wireless charging, Bloomberg's Gurman posited. 
 
https://seekingalpha.com/news/3790696-apple-to-unveil-widest-array-products-in-its-history-this-fall-bloomberg

links.title: Apple to unveil 'widest array' of products in its history this fall: Bloomberg (AAPL)
